poem:
**Server Country**

Shed after shed, the humming barns  
where our questions go to roost.  
Sydney, Melbourne: heat like held breath,  
water bled into chillers,  
coal-shadowed kilowatts ticking up the meter.

They say: build your own power,  
your private sun, your fenced-off wind—  
so nobody pays.

But we all live downstream  
of the cloud.
